basic.description: As the capstone for the applied master's degree, this project requires students to use theory, research methods, and analytical procedures learned in the program to reserach an applied economics question.  Finding are presented in both oral and written format.  The three-hour project is taken in both six-week summer sessions, for a total of six semester hours.  May be repeated to a maximum of nine semester hours.
basic.subject: ECO
basic.title: Applied Master's Project

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisites: ECO 5114, ECO 5117, ECO 5206, ECO 5208, ECO 5420, ECO 5434, or instructor permission.
